bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 37 (Thursday, February 28, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CLAY:H.R. 1446.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:section 8 of article I of the Constitution.[Page H2316]

item.title: H.R. 1446, Multinational Species Conservation Funds Semipostal Stamp Reauthorization Act of 2019

item.text:
Multinational Species Conservation Funds Semipostal Stamp Reauthorization Act of 2019

This bill directs the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) to sell each copy of the Multinational Species Conservation Fund Semipostal Stamp and notify Congress when all copies have been sold.

If the USPS destroys one or more such stamps before this bill's enactment, it shall print and sell the same number of such stamps.

bill.title: Multinational Species Conservation Funds Semipostal Stamp Reauthorization Act of 2019

item.title: Multinational Species Conservation Funds Semipostal Stamp Reauthorization Act of 2019
To require the United States Postal Service to continue selling the Multinational Species Conservation Funds Semipostal Stamp until all remaining stamps are sold, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
